Instructions:

Prepare the Cabbage:

If using fresh cabbage, blanch the leaves in boiling water for 2-3 minutes until pliable. For pickled cabbage, rinse and soak if too salty, then separate the leaves.
Trim the thick stem from each leaf to make rolling easier.

Prepare the Filling:

In a skillet, sauté the chopped onion and garlic until softened.
In a large bowl, combine the ground pork, uncooked rice, sautéed onion and garlic, thyme, oregano, paprika, black pepper, and salt. Mix well.

Stuff the Cabbage Leaves:

Place a tablespoon of the filling at the base of each cabbage leaf.
Fold in the sides and roll tightly, tucking in the ends.

Assemble the Dish:

Layer the bottom of a large pot with chopped cabbage or a few larger leaves.
Arrange the stuffed cabbage rolls on top, seam-side down. Add the chopped bacon (if using) between the layers.
Pour the tomato sauce and water or broth over the rolls to cover them.

Cook:

Cover the pot and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 1.5 to 2 hours, until the cabbage is tender and the flavors have melded.

Serve:

Garnish with fresh herbs before serving. Enjoy hot, with a side of sour cream if desired.
